data.title: Eli Lilly Delivers Strong Q3 Performance, Raises Earnings Outlook
data.description:
Eli Lilly’s Q3 2025 revenue jumped 54% to $17. 6 billion with adjusted EPS of $7. 02, prompting the company to lift its full-year guidance.
source: https://tokenist.com/eli-lilly-delivers-strong-q3-performance-raises-earnings-outlook/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=eli-lilly-delivers-strong-q3-performance-raises-earnings-outlook

data.title: NovaRWA Announces Strategic Partnership with Mapleblock Capital
data.description: Recently, NovaRWA, the RWA infrastructure project, announced a strategic partnership with Web3 investment firm Mapleblock Capital. The two parties will collaborate deeply on RWA asset on-chaining, ecosystem expansion, and market growth, accelerating the application of real-world assets in the blockchain field. Furthermore, the project team revealed that NovaRWA will begin trading and circulation in mid-next month, with more details to be announced soon.

data.title: Bitcoin mining company TeraWulf expands its private placement to $900 million.
data.description: Bitcoin mining company TeraWulf announced it is expanding its private placement to $900 million and finalizing the terms. The offering consists of 0% convertible senior notes due in 2032, with an over-allotment option of $125 million. This offering is an extension of the company's previously disclosed $500 million funding plan, with initial purchasers having a 13-day option to subscribe for additional notes. The company stated that the zero-coupon notes have a conversion premium of 37.5%, which translates to an initial conversion price of approximately $19.94 per share based on Wednesday's closing price of $14.50. If the over-allotment option is fully exercised, the total funding will reach approximately $999.7 million, which will be used for the construction of a data center campus in Abernathy, Texas, and other corporate purposes. (THE BLOCK)

data.title: Australian Police Uncover $6 Million in Cryptocurrency from Criminal Wallet
data.description: According to BlockBeats, Australian Federal Police Commissioner Krissy Barrett announced on Wednesday that a data scientist from the Criminal Asset Confiscation Taskforce successfully unlocked a cryptocurrency wallet containing over $6 million, believed to be held by a suspect. The breakthrough was achieved by identifying falsified numbers within the seed phrase sequence used to secure the wallet. The suspect had attempted to create a 'crypto trap' by adding numbers to the sequence, but the manual alterations were ultimately detected.

data.title: Ethereum's Gas Fees Remain Low Amid Rising Blockchain Activity
data.description:
According to Cointelegraph, Ethereum's blockchain activity is on the rise, yet gas fees on the network remain at historically low levels. This development suggests a more mature and scalable infrastructure capable of supporting advanced real-world applications. Currently, Ethereum transaction fees are at a mere 0.16 gwei, approximately $0.01 per transaction. For token swaps, the fees are slightly higher at $0.15, and for non-fungible token (NFT) sales, they stand at $0.27, as reported by blockchain data aggregator Milkroad. These low costs contrast sharply with previous periods of high network activity, where demand often drove fees to unsustainable levels, a major criticism of Ethereum in past cycles.

The network's daily transactions have surged to 1.6 million, marking a near one-month high, a level last observed at the beginning of October before a significant $19 billion liquidation event. Active addresses have also increased, reaching a monthly peak of 695,872, according to data from the crypto intelligence platform Nansen. The persistently low gas fees follow the implementation of the Dencun and Pectra upgrades, both aimed at reducing transaction costs and enhancing throughput. The Pectra upgrade, deployed in May, has notably doubled the blob capacity of layer-2 (L2) networks, effectively reducing transaction fees on L2s by approximately 50%. This upgrade has also facilitated the offloading of more transactions from the mainnet, further decreasing costs.

Ethereum's previous significant upgrade, Dencun, has also contributed to reducing L2 transaction fees and offloading more transactions from the L1. As a result, average Ethereum transaction fees have become 95% cheaper a year after its deployment on March 13, 2024, as reported by Cointelegraph. This series of upgrades underscores Ethereum's commitment to addressing past criticisms and enhancing its network's efficiency and scalability, paving the way for broader adoption and more complex use cases in the blockchain ecosystem.

data.title: BNB Surpasses 1,120 USDT with a 0.77% Increase in 24 Hours
data.description: On Oct 30, 2025, 10:22 AM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, BNB has crossed the 1,120 USDT benchmark and is now trading at 1,122.469971 USDT, with a narrowed 0.77% increase in 24 hours.

data.title: Stablecoin Introduction Could Pose Policy Challenges, Says Indian Central Bank Deputy Governor
data.description: According to Foresight News, the Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India has expressed concerns about the introduction of stablecoins, stating that it could lead to numerous policy issues that might otherwise be avoidable. The official highlighted the potential challenges that stablecoins could present to the existing financial system and regulatory framework.

source: https://coincu.com/news/bank-indonesia-national-stablecoin/
